Interface FileHandling

  • public interface FileHandling
    Defines constants and abstract funtions to perform file operations in a C compatible manner.

    Interface defines a set of abstract that act similar to standard C library file operations (open, read, ...). Also defined are constants corresponding to error codes that these operations may produce, and enums for lseek() and open() options.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  FileHandling.Errors
      Error codes
      static class  FileHandling.LseekOption
      Options for lseek call
      static class  FileHandling.OpenOption
      Options for open call

    • Method Detail

      • open

        int open​(java.lang.String path,
         FileHandling.OpenOption o)
        Open a file and return a file descriptor.

        This method emulates the standard Unix open call. It takes a String path, and OpenOption constant indication read/write/create options. The total set of options combinations has been limited to those specified in OpenOption enum. The mode_t parameter of the standard open call is not used here.

        On success, returns a non-negative integer as a file descriptor / handle. In case of error a negative value indicating the error is returned (see Errors enum)

      • close

        int close​(int fd)
        Close a file opened by open.

        Close a file indicated by the integer file descriptor. The file handle should be a non-error value returned by open.

        On success, returns 0. In case of error, will return a negative value indicating the error (see Errors enum).

      • write

        long write​(int fd,
           byte[] buf)
        Write to a file indicated by file descriptor.

        Writes byte array to open file indicated by the file descriptor, starting at the current position in the file. Given an array with length n, up to n bytes will be written.

        On success, the number of bytes written is returned. In case of error, a negative value indicating the error is returned (see Errors enum).

      • read

        long read​(int fd,
          byte[] buf)
        Read from a file indicated by file descriptor.

        Read from an open file indicated by the file descriptor, starting at the current position in the file. The read data is placed in the supplied byte array. If the array has a length of n, up to n bytes are read.

        On success, the number of bytes actually read is returned. In case of error, a negative value indicating the error is returned (see Errors enum).

      • lseek

        long lseek​(int fd,
           long pos,
           FileHandling.LseekOption o)
        Change the current position for reading / writing in an open file.

        Change the current read/write position in an open file. Takes a signed integer value for position, and an one of three LseekOption constants which indicate whether the requested position is relative to the start of the file, end of the file or the current position (see LseekOption enum).

        Returns the new position (relative to start of file) on success. In case of error, returns a negative value indicating the error (see Errors enum).

      • unlink

        int unlink​(java.lang.String path)
        Delete a file.

        Delete the file indicated by String path. Returns 0 on success ,or a negative value indicating the error that occured (see Errors enum).

      • clientdone

        void clientdone()
        End session for a particular client.

        This method is called when a client session ends. It will clean up any state, open files, etc. that were asociated with this client. No parameters are needed, as a separate instance of the FileHandling class is created for each client. There is no return value.
